Name: Bas-relief of Osiris
Description: This fragment of relief comes from the excavations of the Egypt Exploration Fund at Abydos. On the left, one notices  part of the image of the god Osiris dressed in the white crown of Upper Egypt and wearing a false beard. Behind him is found a column of text in hieroglyphic writing. The fragment, which dates from the 18th Dynasty, shows several traces of colour.
